document.heading: Surgical Assistant Licensure Amendment Act of 2006

history.narrative: Law 16-228, the “Surgical Assistant Licensure Amendment Act of 2006”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 16-712, which was referred to Committee on Human Services. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on November 14, 2006, and December 5, 2006, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on December 19 2006, it was assigned Act No. 16-557 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 16-228 became effective on March 6, 2007.
